question_stem.en: A 67-year-old man is found dead in his home. The cause of death is not apparent; he had a long history of hypertension and he had a myocardial infarction a year ago. An autopsy is performed. Gross examination of the heart shows white scarring and enlargement of the left ventricle. Histologic findings from a section of the left ventricle are shown below {{exhibit_1}}.
question_stem.zh: 一名67岁男性被发现在家中死亡。死因不明；他有高血压病史，一年前曾发生过心肌梗死。进行了尸检。心脏的肉眼检查显示白色瘢痕和左心室增大。左心室切片的组织学发现如下所示 {{exhibit_1}}。

question.en: The type of collagen seen in the autopsy sample is most likely to be extensively found in which of the following normal body tissues?
question.zh: 在尸检样本中看到的胶原类型最有可能广泛存在于以下哪种正常身体组织中？

explanation.en:
Evolution of a myocardial infarct occurs in several stages. The final stage of the healing process begins approximately 2 weeks after infarction and involves increased deposition of TYPE I COLLAGEN. Fibrosis continues until about 2 months after infarction, resulting in a dense collagenous scar composed primarily of type I collagen. The scar can be identified grossly as a firm, gray-white lesion or microscopically as collagenous tissue replacing myocardium (as in this patient). {{exhibit_3}}

In addition to its role in wound healing, type I collagen (the most abundant type) provides STRENGTH and support for a variety of cellular tissues and organs (eg, tendons, ligaments, skin). It is also the major organic component in BONES and significantly contributes to overall bone strength. Defects in type I collagen can occur in osteogenesis imperfecta, an autosomal dominant disorder that may present with fragile bones and ligament laxity.

(Choices A, C, and D) Basement membrane contains type IV collagen; hyaline cartilage (eg, articular surfaces) and nucleus pulposus contain type II collagen.

(Choice B) Granulation tissue is a capillary-rich fibroblastic proliferation composed primarily of type III collagen. Although granulation tissue is seen approximately 7 days after an acute myocardial infarction, it is eventually replaced by type I collagen as the infarct heals. Type III collagen is involved in the structural maintenance of extensible connective tissues and is often found alongside type I collagen.

Educational objective:
Type I collagen is the primary collagen in mature scars (eg, remote myocardial infarction). It is the most prevalent type of collagen and provides strength and support throughout the human body, particularly in bones, tendons, ligaments, and skin.
explanation.zh:
心肌梗死的演变发生在几个阶段。愈合过程的最后阶段大约在梗死后2周开始，涉及I型胶原蛋白的沉积增加。纤维化持续到梗死后约2个月，导致主要由I型胶原蛋白组成的致密胶原瘢痕。瘢痕可在肉眼下被识别为坚硬的灰白色病灶，或在显微镜下被识别为取代心肌的胶原组织（如本患者）。{{exhibit_3}}

除了在伤口愈合中的作用外，I型胶原蛋白（最丰富的类型）还为各种细胞组织和器官（例如，肌腱、韧带、皮肤）提供强度和支撑。它也是骨骼中的主要有机成分，并对整体骨骼强度有显着贡献。I型胶原蛋白的缺陷可发生在成骨不全症中，这是一种常染色体显性遗传病，可能表现为骨骼脆弱和韧带松弛。

（选项A、C和D）基底膜包含IV型胶原蛋白；透明软骨（例如，关节表面）和髓核包含II型胶原蛋白。

（选项B）肉芽组织是一种毛细血管丰富的成纤维细胞增生，主要由III型胶原蛋白组成。尽管在急性心肌梗死后约7天可见肉芽组织，但随着梗死的愈合，它最终被I型胶原蛋白取代。III型胶原蛋白参与可伸展结缔组织的结构维护，并且通常与I型胶原蛋白一起发现。

教学目标：
I型胶原蛋白是成熟瘢痕（例如，陈旧性心肌梗死）中的主要胶原蛋白。它是人体中最常见的胶原蛋白类型，可在整个身体提供强度和支撑，尤其是在骨骼、肌腱、韧带和皮肤中。

summary.en: This question tests knowledge of collagen types and their distribution in various tissues, specifically focusing on the type of collagen found in scar tissue after a myocardial infarction. The key to solving this question is understanding that type I collagen is the most abundant collagen in the body and is prevalent in tissues like tendons, ligaments, skin, and bone, as well as in mature scars.
summary.zh: 这道题考察了对胶原蛋白类型及其在各种组织中的分布的了解，特别侧重于心肌梗死后瘢痕组织中发现的胶原蛋白类型。解决这道题的关键是理解I型胶原蛋白是体内最丰富的胶原蛋白，并且在肌腱、韧带、皮肤和骨骼等组织以及成熟瘢痕中普遍存在。
